appTitle: Survey on Best Practices in Software Testing

tcle.hide: Hide Term of Free and Informed Consent
tcle.show: Show Term of Free and Informed Consent
tcle.introductionContent:
I agree to participate in the non-invasive studies carried out by the researchers, as part of the research activities Characterization and classification of good test cases: best practices, essential features, and tools.

During this process, concepts about quality in test cases and associated practices will be presented. I understand that during the activities I will assimilate these concepts and apply this knowledge throughout the stages. The researchers will carry out the study consisting of the collection, analysis, and reporting of data from the responses developed. I understand that I am not required to provide information about my answers in the activity and that I can request the removal of my results from the experiment at any time. I understand that there will be no additional credit or benefit for participating in these studies. I also understand that when data is collected and analyzed, my name will be removed from the data and will not be used at any time during the analysis or when the results are presented.
tcle.confidentialityContent: All information collected in this study is confidential and my name will not be identified at any time. Likewise, I undertake not to communicate this content, to keep confidential the practices presented that are part of the experiment, and to respect the declared rules and licenses.
tcle.benefitsContent: I understand that the benefits I will receive from this study are limited to learning the material that is distributed and taught to fulfill the research process, regardless of whether or not I participate in these studies, but that the researchers hope to learn more about quality practices in test cases and the benefits that these studies bring to the context of Software Engineering. I understand that I am free to ask questions at any time or request that any information related to me not be included in the study. I understand that my participation is of my own free will with the sole objective of contributing to the advancement and development of techniques and processes for Software Engineering.
tcle.accept: I have read and agree to the Term of Free and Informed Consent

stepTwo.title: Best Practices Evaluation
stepTwo.instructions: Next, a set of practices related to the quality of test cases is presented. Provide your opinion on each one considering if you Strongly Agree, Agree, are Neutral, Disagree, or Strongly Disagree with each of them. Additionally, if desired, it is also possible to include an observation for each practice. If you have questions about what a particular practice entails, the 'Show More' link provides a brief description of the practice in question. There are 40 practices in total.

bp1.title: Atomic Specification of Test Cases
bp1.description: Test cases are focused on a single requirement aspect.

bp2.title: Complete Independence of Test Cases
bp2.description: Test cases are independent from each other.

bp3.title: Coverage of Normal and Exceptional Flows
bp3.description: Test cases cover both normal and exceptional flows.

bp4.title: Boundary Values Analysis
bp4.description: Test cases perform boundary value analysis.

bp6.title: Detailed Analysis of Size and Complexity
bp6.description: Test cases are small and manageable in terms of size and complexity.

bp7.title: Complex Design for Error Detection
bp7.description: Complex test cases are designed to detect significant errors.

bp9.title: Complete Traceability of Test Cases
bp9.description: Test cases have traceability links to requirements and source code.

bp10.title: Strict Use of Performance and Security Testing
bp10.description: Performance and security tests are conducted regularly.

bp11.title: Separation of Testing and Development Activities
bp11.description: Testing activities are separated from development activities.

bp13.title: Clear Understanding of Test Cases
bp13.description: Test cases are clear and easy to understand.

bp14.title: Early Planning of Testing Plan
bp14.description: Testing is involved early in the planning phase.

bp15.title: Structured Coverage of Testing Process
bp15.description: Structured approaches for integration testing are used.

bp16.title: Complete Assurance of Test Code Quality
bp16.description: High code coverage is ensured for test cases.

bp17.title: Proper Utilization of Code Coverage
bp17.description: Code coverage metrics are properly utilized to ensure test quality.

bp18.title: Required Utilization of Missing Tests
bp18.description: New tests are created to cover untested code based on coverage metrics.

bp19.title: Efficient Utilization of Code Coverage
bp19.description: Higher error detection rates are aimed for in high coverage areas.

bp20.title: Small Generation Footprint
bp20.description: Test cases have a small footprint and execute minimal code.

bp21.title: Complete Prioritization of Test Cases Design
bp21.description: The design of test cases is prioritized to cover diverse requirements.

bp22.title: Responsible Addition of Maintenance
bp22.description: Test cases are added during maintenance to cover fixed bugs.

bp23.title: Suitable Utilization of Test Assertions
bp23.description: Test cases include appropriate assertions to detect errors.

bp24.title: Responsible Addition of Debugging Comments
bp24.description: Debugging comments are added in the test code.

bp25.title: Deterministic Design of Results
bp25.description: Test cases are designed for deterministic results.

bp26.title: Complete Avoidance of Side Effects
bp26.description: Test cases do not have side effects.

bp27.title: Suitable Utilization of Labels and Categories
bp27.description: Labels or categories are used to organize test cases.

bp28.title: Responsible Utilization of Test Case Automatic Generation
bp28.description: Tools for automatic generation of test cases are used responsibly.

bp29.title: Responsible Utilization of Management Tools
bp29.description: Test management tools are used effectively.

bp30.title: Suitable Utilization of Estimation Tools
bp30.description: Estimation tools are used to evaluate test effort and schedule.

bp31.title: Suitable Utilization of Coverage Measurement Tool
bp31.description: Coverage measurement tools are used to ensure comprehensive testing.

bp32.title: Complete Utilization of Continuous Integration Tool
bp32.description: Continuous integration tools are integrated for automated test execution.

bp33.title: Suitable Selection of Testing Tools
bp33.description: Testing tools are selected based on project requirements.

bp34.title: Aligned Adjustment of Organizational Testing
bp34.description: Testing activities are aligned with business orientation.

bp35.title: Responsible Utilization of Risk-based Testing
bp35.description: Testing efforts are prioritized based on risk levels.

bp37.title: Conscious Impact on Knowledge Management Strategy
bp37.description: Business orientation impacts knowledge management strategy.

bp38.title: Carefully Measure Outsourcing Impact
bp38.description: The impact of outsourcing testing activities is measured.

bp39.title: Complete Utilization of Testing Methodology
bp39.description: Defined testing methodologies are adhered to.

bp40.title: Clear Definition of Testing Responsible
bp40.description: Professionals or teams responsible for testing activities are clearly defined.

stepThree.title: Evaluation of Best Practices
stepThree.instructions: Next, a set of practices related to the quality of test cases is presented along with the category, the domain it belongs to, and the use where it can be mainly framed. Choose the level of relevance of each practice regarding its category, domain, and use. Additionally, if desired, it is also possible to include an observation for each practice.

stepFour.title: Priorization of Best Practices
stepFour.instructions: Next, a set of practices related to the quality of test cases is presented in random order. Drag and order the practices according to the level of priority you consider.

stepFive.title: Tools for Practices
stepFive.knowTool: Do you know any testing tool that supports this practice?

thankYou.title: Thank You!
thankYou.message: Thank you for completing the survey. We appreciate your feedback.
